comments.commentBody:
Governor Walker is just an antagonizing troublemaker who can't get along with anyone and fought his own people. He does not represent the people.

All governments in America are cooperative efforts by and for the people to assure our security, peace and prosperity. Republicans are in government to destroy them like Trojan Horses.

This Op-ed is certainly no surprise to me. Just another troublemaker trying to make a name for himself by appealing to peoples hatred, angers and fear. Just like Trump. Timing is everything.

He must be lobbying for a position.

Dear Governor Walker. I founders never intended that the Federal Government would send block grants to States from taxes of people who didn't live in those States. That's called taxation without representation something our founders were a tad vocal about.

If you want to govern your state free of federal government interference stop taking Federal tax dollars. I would bet you might need to raise taxes because right now the good people of CA and NY are paying your bills and they voted for Democrats.

Block grants to the States with no strings attached isn't what the founders envisioned.

According to Scott Walker, if we show up to voice our concern about policies that affect our lives, we're automatically "liberals" trying to "intimidate" lawmakers instead of citizens engaging in democracy. Apparently GOP leaders think voters should just shut up and let the rulers rule. I'd change that tone, Mister.
Government of the rich, by the rich and for the rich with crumbs for all others. Christian and democratic values pushed aside to make way for greed, fear and resentment.

Return to the states? Really? You mean the generous, thoughtful, forward looking states like Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama? The ones that strive to keep people uneducated, unemployed and unhealthy? The ones that still make voting hard for black people after holding onto segregation for a hundred years? Those states? The ones we should trust with the rights of others? Justice and fairness are not geographic. Brave man with Koch money.
And then the wealthier states will build walls, and get the poorer states to pay for them.

What? The Koch Brothers couldn't persuade Sam Brownback or Pat McGrory to deliver their pitiful whine of victimhood?

An absurd missive like this proves that the Republicans are feeling the heat. Their agenda is at best unpopular, at core, repulsive and they know it. Only the richest of the rich and largest of the large corporations benefit and when implemented will generate a backlash that they hope ti survive thru gerrymandering and voter suppression. In the meantime, whine whine whine and when the whining doesn't work, blame the liberals for being mean.
Making assumptions and drawing conclusions that have no basis in fact seems to be in vogue this year. Scott Walker apparently is just another case in point.

Gov. Clear Thinker believes the greatest issue of our time is drug testing for food stamp recipients. Only in Scott's dim universe is this not harassment.

Perhaps he should be tested too, for he appears to be delusional.

Not to worry.  When Ryan's budget axes funding for food stamps, CHIPs etc. the drug testing won't be necessary.  But  maybe before sports team owners get any more taxpayer provided stadiums, they should be drug tested.  My observation have been in my 77 years that there are just as many very wealthy and successful people using cocaine and marijuana as poor people.  The wealthy are not as likely to use meth or heroin, but there are always exceptions.  The daughter of one of the couples living in my gated community and her centi-millionaire husband  died of heroin overdoses in their London townhouse several years back!

Bravo for taking on the teachers' union and showing those overpaid teachers a thing or two. Why should they have the right to collective bargaining which gives them too much control over the government?  Who cares about the 100,000 protesters who "decended on the Capitol". Ignore their "intimidation"! They were probably paid agitators. Us real Americans are behind you!
I hope this is sarcasm!

Governor Walker, you didn't mention your huge cuts in funding for one of the world's premier educational institutions, the University of Wisconsin. But then, as the country's only governor who never earned a college degree I guess you don't value the University nor do you appreciate the value of the perspective and critical thinking provided by a broad, education. On the contrary, you have ridiculed the "garbage courses" taught at the University and insisted that the mission of U of W should be that of a trade school -- to "meet the state's workforce needs".

If those darn liberals with their federal regulations would just get out of the way, the economy would run like it did under St. Ronald Reagan; and freedom will be restored. It's all very simple.

Full disclosure: Mr. Walker is now running for a third term as governor of Wisconsin, and when he looks in the mirror, he still sees a future POTUS.

What health insurance does Gov. Walker have and who pays for it? And as for his claim that the American people spoke in the last election, Ms. Clinton received almost 3 million more votes than her opponent.

These protests are a normal reaction when people realize they've been had. Scott Walker's commentary is pure propaganda for the far right. Remove all government benefits for the working class and you won't need government. Yet they'll still have government jobs and benefits. Doesn't sound very fair to me.

I will listen to Republican elected officials when the common man has the same gold plated health insurance plan that they have. These hucksters will repeal the ACA and give "tax credits", amounting to pennies, and will claim budget victory. Then use that "savings" to build an ineffective wall.

And what about the budget for the military?  Why do "you" always look away about one of the largest  bureaucratic institutions.   Why should they get all the money for tanks that are not needed and air planes that cost 1B a pop?  There is much more  bureaucracy in the military then in any other branch of govt.  Whole cities seem to be on the govt dole. with folks who much of the time do little to increase the GDP.  They perpetuate wars so that can perpetuate their livelihood.   So when  you talk about  inefficiency please be more inclusive!

And how are republicans going to spend all the money they "save" the taxpayers?  By throwing it away on warships and fighter planes.  We have no enemies that have either so it is just a gift to the military industrial complex (you are too young to remember the greatest republican president in the past century - Ike).  I would rather have my tax dollars going to feed people and give them decent housing than war mongering.  You need to grow a heart.

I love the state's right hypocrisy.  They love state's rights when it comes to allowing discrimination and/or blocking voters from voting.  However, when it comes to states legalizing marijuana suddenly our lying AG, Jeff Sessions, feels compelled to overrule state's rights.  It all seems pretty phony to me.

And here, in a nutshell, is the biggest problem we have in this country. The comments pour in and they either vilify Walker or they vilify the people who protest against Walker. If we could just tone down the rhetoric and *listen* to each other, we could get somewhere. Let's put our energies into sorting the wheat from the chaff instead of burning down the whole crop.
Where have you been?.....these GOP KOCH BROTHER CLOWNS  have destroyed our country's values while dupping half the country  to support them sorta like a "political battered wife syndrome"!!!!!!!

"Listening to Walker" is the same as appeasement. You only have to read the second paragraph where he equates citizens exercising their first amendment rights with "intimidation."  You stand up against these people, period.

On the contrary, I think a lot of people did listen to Walker.  And watch what he did.  They're responding to that.  The comments against Walker don't vilify him.  They just report what he thinks and what he's done.  So readers know the full Walker story -- something this opinion piece didn't bother to relate.

Nonsense.
The electoral majority wanted jobs, a President who tells the truth, and one whose spouse is not a philanderer. They will learn that the have gotten none of this -- except perhaps a chaste spouse.
The real majority knew this already, and did not vote for fraud.
You seem to like your bureaurcracy when it wears medals, and procures more weapons --- .the real zombie mask wearing death eaters, producing nothing but more insecurity.
I prefer those who keep my air and water clean, my food unadulterated, and prevent banksters, pharmacecutical, auto, telecommunications, and a whole host of cother corporate cheaters from ripping me off.
How about if the next time they do, I send the bill to you.

This beautiful article was apparently finished around Valentine's Day and there was no announcement of her passing, so she's apparently still alive. But yes, this comment was clueless and somewhat patronizing.

I am beyond devastated.  For Amy, for her children, for Jason.  What a beautiful love story and a family.  Life is not fair.  Not by a long shot.  Heaven gained another angel.  Amy and Jason have installed the best human being can install in children.  They will be OK.  In time.  So will Jason.  With, or without another wife.  His children, grandchildren will be there for him.  What she and Jason had is impossible to replicate.  I lost my husband to a freak plane crash many years ago.  I know the pain of a sudden loss.  I know the feeling of your heart being ripped out of you.  My marriage was young and nowhere near 26 years in length like Amy's and Jason's and it still took years to get back to "normal".  I hope Jason recovers much faster than I did.

it's only stunning if you still think that republicans actually give a flying fig about the country.  eight years of Obama obstruction (racism), a willingness to shut down the government and default on the national debt, and millions of dollars and countless hours wasted on demonizing Hillary--but not really wasted, as they succeeded in getting the hillbillies to hate her and vote for trump--are proof positive that the republicans care only for two things:  white men and money.

Even when you try to live for today, things can broadside you.

Last year, my wife, age 36, went from the healthiest person I knew to dead in four months from aggressive pancreatic cancer.

http://justinmiller.io/posts/2016/06/07/writing-move-on/

These things happen and underscore the frailty in thinking that the present continues on unchecked and is bound by some sort of rule of inertia.

Don't wait; do the things you want to do today.
I am so very sorry.
Justin I am so sorry. I hope things are getting better. Somehow. Good luck.

So sorry for your loss. Though I am a total stranger to you (just as I am to Ms AKR) I will pray pray for your future Mr Miller. May you find Happiness again. All the very Best to you.

And for Ms Rosenthal, no matter how a very few here says we should not hope for miracles, I will continue to pray for a medical miracle and she and her loving family have more, plenty more of loving time together.

My dear friend had me at "devastatingly beautiful" when he shared your piece and the impact it had on him... because I love him and things that touch the heart of he and his family, I immediately dove in... I lost my breath at "Ovarian Cancer", you see I too walked into a hospital with someone I loved who was in unexplained pain and I too walked out with the unexpected diagnosis of Ovarian Cancer... it was my Mother. I remember watching as she and my Father, her love of 48 years, walked out side by side their heads down in a "foggy shock"... My heart is with you and all who love you, especially your love Jason. The mirror you reflect for us all of this beautiful man (and your love of him) is a treasure... May we all embrace Plan "Be" as we ride the waves of our present and may we all know the love that fairy tales are made like the love of you and your Prince...
A beautiful piece and timely reminder. Plan Be, it is. Thank you, Amy. This is the first piece by you I've read, but not the last.
